name: dulcitone
definition: A keyboard instrument similar to the celesta, in which hammers strike a set of tuning forks for sound production.
description:
A dulcitone is a keyboard instrument in which sound is produced by a range of tuning forks, which vibrate when struck by felt-covered hammers activated by the keyboard.

The tuning forks give off a sound very similar to a celesta, but rounder and sweeter, with less piercing harmonics.

The tuning forks are acoustically coupled to and thus amplified by a spruce soundboard that rests under the instrument.

A significant feature of the dulcitone was its portability, a product of its lightweight and compact construction and the fact that the tuning forks were not prone to going out of tune.

The dulcitone is a transposing instrument; it sounds an octave higher than the standard written pitch. It has a five octave written range.

However, the volume produced is extremely limited, and the dulcitone's part is frequently substituted by a glockenspiel.

The dulcitone continues to play a role in popular music.
